title: Errors could be more helpful.
body:
For example, I have this error:

```
Uncaught Error: Invariant Violation: addComponentAsRefTo(...): Only a ReactOwner can have refs. This usually means that you're trying to add a ref to a component that doesn't have an owner (that is, was not created inside of another component's `render` method). Try rendering this component inside of a new top-level component which will hold the ref.invariant @ react-famous.js:14029ReactOwner.addComponentAsRefTo @ react-famous.js:17122attachRef @ react-famous.js:17000ReactRef.attachRefs @ react-famous.js:17016attachRefs @ react-famous.js:16872assign.notifyAll @ react-famous.js:16708ON_DOM_READY_QUEUEING.close @ react-famous.js:30946Mixin.closeAll @ react-famous.js:18011Mixin.perform @ react-famous.js:17952batchedMountComponentIntoNode @ react-famous.js:22009Mixin.perform @ react-famous.js:17938ReactDefaultBatchingStrategy.batchedUpdates @ react-famous.js:29068batchedUpdates @ react-famous.js:16465ReactMount._renderNewRootComponent @ react-famous.js:22144ReactPerf.measure.wrapper @ react-famous.js:16813ReactMount.render @ react-famous.js:22233ReactPerf.measure.wrapper @ react-famous.js:16813(anonymous function) @ main.jsx:114runStartupCallbacks @ startup_client.js:30ready @ startup_client.js:32
```

At the bottom, I see my file, `main.jsx`. That file does this:

``` js
    React.render(<Root />, document.body)
```

main.jsx renders the root of my UI. My UI is big. Obviously being pointed to the root of the UI is not so helpful.

It'd be great if the error pointed to the specific part of the render tree where this is happening. For now, I'll go on a wild goose chase.
